definition: to use force/to come to blows
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: Keeping our military and using them when we have to, but not as our first instrument.
sentences.chinese: 保存军事力量，不到非不得已绝不轻易动武。

sentences.english: The shooter bent weapons on her.
It was blowback operated, automatic weapon that fired from the open bolt.
sentences.chinese: 这是后坐力操作，自动武器，从开放的螺栓开枪。

sentences.english: Iraq and Afghanistan were lessons in the impotence of force without legitimacy.
sentences.chinese: 伊拉克和阿富汗正是没有合法授权下动武的教训。

sentences.english: They are not afraid to use violence against Gulliver, though their arrows are little more than pinpricks .
sentences.chinese: 他们不怕对格列佛动武，哪怕他们的箭比针刺还小。

sentences.english: the teacher is not completely calm when he or she takes the action.
sentences.chinese: 老师在动武的时候情绪不完全地稳定。

sentences.english: Secret Service officers had automatic weapons drawn as they patrolled Lafayette Park, across from the White House.
sentences.chinese: 特工人员手持自动武器在白宫对面的拉斐特公园警戒。

sentences.english: I mean, and we be in choler, we'll draw.
sentences.chinese: 我说，咱们要是发起脾气来，就会拔刀子动武。

sentences.english: One of the polite accusations is that he is a " unilateralist".
sentences.chinese: 其中较文雅的指责是他是一个“单方面动武主义”。

definition: to use violence (against sb)/to strong-arm sb/to manhandle
to be ready to go to war
to start a war/to open hostilities
lit. to refrain from shooting at the rat for fear of breaking the vases (idiom)/to not act against an evil so as to prevent harm to innocents
to fall out with sb/to become hostile
to gain the initiative by striking first (idiom); to preempt/to anticipate/preemptive
